channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report E-2023110337
item.description:
Report E-2023110337

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 25-gallon release of Methyl Chloroform-343 (UN2831) from a 55-gallon metal drum. The product is regulated as a UN2831, 1,1,1 Trichloroethena, 6.1, III. Because of the toxic hazardous properties of the material, ERTS advised they would be sending a contractor to assist with this spill. One of the drums of the product was punctured by a forklift during unloading by the LSL terminal, causing the release to impact the trailer interior, pallet, and dock. The drum was tipped onto its side to prevent further spilling and absorbents were deployed onto the spilled area. The terminal uprighted the drum and deployed absorbents. Upon contractor arrival it was estimated 1Gal was released in a 4'x4' area. 1-85 gallon DM / contains overpacked drum, impacted absorbentsand 1-55 gallon DM / contains impacted absorbents, PPE were left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110324
item.description:
Report E-2023110324

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: ST JAMES
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 09:00 AM a Basic Chemicals truck driver was delivering Caustic Soda to a customer site (Mosaic) located in St. James, LA. The driver met with the customer site operator, completed the “In the Interest of Safety Form” (which is a form utilized by Basic Chemical truck drivers to ensure that enough space exists in a customer tank prior to unloading), hooked up offloading hoses, and began offloading. Near the end of offloading, the driver knew the tanker trailer was getting close to being empty, so he got with the customer site operator to check the level of the storage tank again to ensure there was enough room remaining in the product storage tank. The operator checked the level of the storage tank and confirmed with the driver that there was enough space to complete the offload. Not long after the customer site operator left the area the storage tank began to overflow and the Basic Chemicals truck driver immediately shut down the flow of product. The driver got with the customer site operator to notify him of the overflow and the operator stated that the tank level indicator had been malfunctioning lately. Customer site personnel were able to clean up the spill which was estimated to be approximately 20 gallons. No injuries or damage to equipment was reported.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came out of a 53 foot trailer in unload leaking. Package handlers notified QA who then took it out of sortation and placed package in a drum to be processed DescribePack: 1 cap was loose causing minor spillage that seeped through fiberboard box DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately taken out of sortation and staged for QA to process

item.title: Report E-2023110227
item.description:
Report E-2023110227

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSL experienced a UN2920 Spectrus NX1103 release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of material released to an 8’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. A soap and water solution was utilized to clean all impacted surfaces. Absorbents were then deployed to collect all material. The damaged jug and impacted absorbents were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged cut up pallet was placed into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted surfaces were scrubbed and treated thoroughly but still showed signs of staining, and all surfaces passed the water test. All other unaffected jugs were re-stacked to continue to the destination. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE PACKAGE WAS MIS HANDLED THEREFFORE THE PACKAGE WAS CONTAINED TO A SAFE HAZMAT CONTAINER DUE TO THE SAFETY OF THE STAFF DescribePack: IT APPEARS THE CAP WAS LOOSE ON THE BOTTLE AND MAJORITY OF THE CONTENTS LEAKED OUT DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS REMOVED FROM THE TRAILER AND DURING THE PROCESS THE PACKAGE BEGAN TO LEAK DUE TO THE CAP BEING LOOSE

item.title: Report X-2023110128
item.description:
Report X-2023110128

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found by QA in the morning, it was in the truck from outbound and a package handler trainer took it out the truck. Thankfully no one was hurt. QA put the damaged hazmat in the correct tote and went to the hazmat cage to process properly. DescribePack: The bottle inside had the cap completely off the bottle which caused the leakage to happen. The cap wasn't on tight enough considering the product is hazardous. Possibly the package was also damaged by the driver as well because it was on the route when it got damaged. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: QA placed the hazmat in a red tote and transported the hazmat to the hazmat cage to process properly.

item.title: Report X-2023110051

Report X-2023110051

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: SAINT ROSE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS REFUSED BY THE CUSTOMER BECAUSE THE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE WAS ALL WET FROM THE LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE ETHANOL CONTAINERS. ONCE DRIVER RETURNED THE PACKAGE IT WAS PLACED IMMEDIATELY INSIDE A HAZMAT BIN FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION THE CONTAINER HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING LEAKAGE WHILE BEING TRANSPORTED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BIN TO MITIGATE THE LEAKAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023110024
item.description:
Report X-2023110024

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in unload by package handler. QA noticed it was a dry wet spot, on the box. Taking a look inside QA noticed that the product said it was Sulfuric Acid. There was no labeling on package to state it was a hazmat. QA checked for the SDS and it was an actually Hazardous material. QA got a red tote and brought package to the hazmat area. DescribePack: The cap on the bottle was loose and spilled out inside box. The peanuts inside did not cover the bottles entirely. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Brought package to hazmat area in red tote to be processed properly.

item.title: Report X-2023110021
item.description:
Report X-2023110021

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in unload damaged with the box being wet on both sides. At first QA assumed that the package was damaged by another package but after taking a closer look at package it was damaged from the inside. QA got a red tote and transported the hazmat to the rightful place to processed properly. DescribePack: The package had no inner packing inside the package, which highly caused the bottle's cap to become loose. No care was put in transporting a corrosive hazardous item. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA placed hazmat in red tote and brought it to the hazmat area to be processed properly.
